abstract.p: Drkoop.com health Web site secures $20 million in financing and shakes up its management team; money, put up by investors including Prime Ventures, J F Shea Ventures, Cramer-Rosenthal-McGlynn and RMC Capital, comes one day after Web site expressed doubts about remaining in business; Richard Rosenblatt is named chief executive; Edward Cespedes is named president and Stephen Plutsky is named chief financial officer; C Everett Koop will remain chairman (S)

block.p: The drkoop.com health Web site has stepped back from the brink once more, saying it had secured $20 million in financing and had shaken up its management team. The money, put up by investors including Prime Ventures, JF Shea Ventures, Cramer-Rosenthal-McGlynn and RMC Capital, comes just a day after drkoop.com expressed serious doubts about remaining in business. Drkoop.com also said it had revamped its leadership core, tapping Richard Rosenblatt as chief executive, Edward Cespedes as president and Stephen Plutsky as chief financial officer. C. Everett Koop, the former surgeon general and founder of the Web site, will remain chairman.

The money, put up by investors including Prime Ventures, JF Shea Ventures, Cramer-Rosenthal-McGlynn and RMC Capital, comes just a day after drkoop.com expressed serious doubts about remaining in business. Drkoop.com also said it had revamped its leadership core, tapping Richard Rosenblatt as chief executive, Edward Cespedes as president and Stephen Plutsky as chief financial officer. C. Everett Koop, the former surgeon general and founder of the Web site, will remain chairman.
